data.title: Programs & Academics
data.text:
No matter where your English skills are, we can help you improve your oral and written communication skills for work, community, and academic goals. Learn more about ESL classes at Lane.

Not confident about starting college? Need to earn your GED? The Adult Basic and Secondary Education (ABSE) department has options to help you meet your goals.

Looking to take a class before you’ve graduated from high school? Looking to take a class just for fun? Lane offers a variety of educational opportunities for members of the community who aren’t looking to earn a degree, in addition to engagement opportunities like Rites of Passage, Continuing Education, Senior Programming, and community events.

Whether an internship is required for your degree or not, you have the opportunity to develop work experience during your program to set yourself apart when applying for jobs. Only need an internship? Options are also available for students not earning a degree at Lane. Connect with the Cooperative Education Department.

Expand your worldview and take a term (or more) abroad! With a wide variety of programs and places to choose from, there is something exciting and enriching for everyone. Discover Study Abroad options at Lane Community College.

Phi Theta Kappa (PTK) is a national honor society that helps recognize and encourage scholarship among associate degree students. Participating students may be eligible for additional PTK scholarships to help fund their studies! Learn more about joining the Sigma Zeta chapter of PTK at Lane.

The Honors program adds to the breadth and depth of your educational experience, helping you gain critical thinking and research skills that are beneficial in the workforce and in preparing for graduate school. Learn more about requirements and how to apply to the Honors Program.
